main event: On February 1, 1961, a bright silver-like object with an orange tail was observed hovering in Cambridge, Massachusetts for 4-5 hours.
interesting points: The object was seen disappearing to the north at an elevation of approximately 45 degrees., The observer speculated it may have been the planet Venus due to atmospheric distortions., The sighting was reported through Project Blue Book and included by a civilian source., The observation length was significant, lasting several hours., No physical evidence or photographs were recorded in the report.
sighted object: a bright silver-like object with an orange tail
